section.title: Student Resources
section.p: PCC and the world at large offer several resources that you may benefit from while taking this course.

subsection.title: Tutoring
subsection.p: The Tutoring Center at Sylvania offers free tutoring in math. You should find some time to check it out, if you havenâ€™t already. Details can be found at www.pcc.edu/resources/tutoring/sylvania.
As a PCC student, you have access to free online tutoring as well. Visit www.pcc.edu/resources/tutoring/sylvania/student-success/math-center for details.

subsection.title: Calculator Handbooks
subsection.p: The PCC math department has written calculator handbooks for the TI-89, TI-Voyage 200, and the Casio ClassPad 330. These handbooks are less dense than the comprehensive manuals that come with each calculatorm and are focused on topics relevant to PCC courses. Download each one at spot.pcc.edu/academ/math/download.htm.

subsection.title: Online Videos
subsection.p: At the Khan Academy (www.khanacademy.org) you can find thousands of 10- to 30-minute videos on various mathematics topics. See what you can find that may be relevant to the topics we are studying in class using appropriate search terms.
Khan Academy is just one such site. See what else you can find online searching for math videos. If you find a series of videos that you feel is helpful, keep visiting them as the term progresses.

subsection.title: College Success Courses
subsection.p: Several one-credit courses are available to help you maximize your success in the college experience. These include courses specifically geared to study skills. Visit www.pcc.edu/resources/panther-tracks/college-success/study-skills.html to learn more.

subsection.title: Math Study Skills
subsection.p: PCC instructor Jessica Bernards co-authored these free lessons on study skills that help people succeed in math courses. spot.pcc.edu/mathstudyskills

subsection.title: Multicultural Center
subsection.p: A welcoming and inclusive space for diverse students. One of many services is one-on-one help for math courses. www.pcc.edu/resources/culture

subsection.title: Veteran's Resource Center
subsection.p: Relax, connect, computer workstations, work study and volunteer opportunities, and more.

subsection.title: Women's Resource Center
subsection.p: A wide variety of services that support the academic achievement of women. www.pcc.edu/resources/women/sylvania

subsection.title: Counseling Services
subsection.p: Get help dealing with personal or career concerns that may be impacting your academic success. Trained professional counselors can also assist you with decision-making, goal-setting, and personal development.
